goals.description: These preliminary exercises serve as preparation for the subsequent exercises on the slackline
The system will guide you through more and more challenging exercises and show how you can strengthen your physical balance
This will give you first insights about how your body behaves to unexpected movements
Pay attention the coherence of your perception and motoric movements
On the right side you will find general tips that are helpful for the entire tier level and adaptable to slacklining itself

tips.description: For a better experience it is recommended to train barefoot or with socks, but this is up to you
Bend your knees slightly. This will bring you into a better initial position for movement compensation
Set a focus point in front of you. In each execution screen you will see a dot that represents this
In almost each exercise your hand should be over your shoulder and bent in about 135 degree to the side
Slow but controlled execution, feel the imbalance and counteract
Relax yourself to react faster to imbalances but have a straight upper body to hold you in the right position

exercises.description: Stay on your right foot and balance with the left one

tips.description: For each exercise you will find a looping video that shows the correct execution on the right side
Here you will find tips for the specific exercises. We start with a relatively simple one.
Your chosen sides leg servers as standing leg on the ground
Raise the other leg to the side and stretch it
The upper body is straight
Your arms should be loose
And focus on a point in front of you
For each exercise you will find a looping video that shows the correct execution on the right side
Here you will find tips for the specific exercises. We start with a relatively simple one.
Your chosen sides leg servers as standing leg on the ground
Raise the other leg to the side and stretch it
The upper body is straight
Your arms should be loose
And focus on a point in front of you

exercises.description: Stay on your right foot, other in the air and arms stretched out

tips.description: Your chosen sides leg servers as standing leg on the ground
Raise the other one to the side and stretch it
You upper body is straight
This time the arms are slightly bent and over your shoulder
Focus on a point in front of you
Your chosen sides leg servers as standing leg on the ground
Raise the other one to the side and stretch it
You upper body is straight
This time the arms are slightly bent and over your shoulder
Focus on a point in front of you

exercises.description: Stay on your right foot, other in the air and cross your arms

tips.description: Your chosen sides leg servers as standing leg on the ground
Raise the other one to the side and stretch it
You upper body is straight
Your arms are crossed in front of your body
Focus on a point in front of you
Your chosen sides leg servers as standing leg on the ground
Raise the other one to the side and stretch it
You upper body is straight
Your arms are crossed in front of your body
Focus on a point in front of you

exercises.description: Stay on your right foot and raise your other leg to the front. Lean forward with your upper body and fixate the left leg with both arms

tips.description: Your chosen sides leg servers as standing leg on the ground
Raise the other one to the front as high as you can
Now lean your body towards the upper leg
Stretch your arms out to the front
Fixate now your lifted leg with your hands as far as you can
Your chosen sides leg servers as standing leg on the ground
Raise the other one to the front as high as you can
Now lean your body towards the upper leg
Stretch your arms out to the front
Fixate now your lifted leg with your hands as far as you can

exercises.description: Stay on your right foot and raise your other leg to the side. Lean sideward with your upper body and fixate the left leg with both arms

tips.description: Your chosen sides leg servers as standing leg on the ground
Raise the other one to the side as high as you can
Now lean your body to the side towards the upper leg
Stretch your arms out to the side
And fixate your lifted leg with your hands as far as you can
Your chosen sides leg servers as standing leg on the ground
Raise the other one to the side as high as you can
Now lean your body to the side towards the upper leg
Stretch your arms out to the side
And fixate your lifted leg with your hands as far as you can

exercises.description: Stay on your right foot and raise your other leg to the side. Stretch your arms out and circle your leg clockwise in the air

tips.description: Your chosen sides leg servers as standing leg on the ground
Raise the other one to the side as high as you can
Your your arms are bent and over you shoulder
The upper body is relaxed but straight
Focus on a point in front of you
Your chosen sides leg servers as standing leg on the ground
Raise the other one to the side as high as you can
Your your arms are bent and over you shoulder
The upper body is relaxed but straight
Focus on a point in front of you

exercises.description: Stay on your right foot. Bent your other leg and stabilize it sideways with the sole into your knee. Stretch your arms out.

tips.description: Your chosen sides leg servers as standing leg on the ground
Raise your other foot upwards and bent it
Stabilize it sideways with the sole into your standing legs knee
Arms are bent and over your shoulder
Straight but relaxed upper body
Your chosen sides leg servers as standing leg on the ground
Raise your other foot upwards and bent it
Stabilize it sideways with the sole into your standing legs knee
Arms are bent and over your shoulder
Straight but relaxed upper body

exercises.description: Stay on your right foot. Other foot up and stretch it behind your body. Arms are stretched out. Now bend your standing leg, go down until you feel confident and go up.

tips.description: Your chosen sides leg servers as standing leg on the ground
Raise your other foot upwards
Move it to the back of your body
Now do a squat by bending your standing legs knee and going down with your whole body
Hold this position for a short time
Your chosen sides leg servers as standing leg on the ground
Raise your other foot upwards
Move it to the back of your body
Now do a squat by bending your standing legs knee and going down with your whole body
Hold this position for a short time

exercises.description: Stay on your right foot. Other foot up and stretch it in front of your body. Arms are stretched out. Now bend your standing leg, go down until you feel confident and go up.

tips.description: Your chosen sides leg servers as standing leg on the ground
Raise your other foot upwards
Move it now to the front of your body
Now do a squat by bending your standing legs knee and going down with your whole body
Hold this position for a short time
Your chosen sides leg servers as standing leg on the ground
Raise your other foot upwards
Move it now to the front of your body
Now do a squat by bending your standing legs knee and going down with your whole body
Hold this position for a short time

goals.description: Congratulations and welcome to the new unlocked tier! Here you will have your first contact with the slackline
Get a feeling for the slackline, become familiar with it, feel the imbalance of your body and stay calm
You will notice how your body behaves and how to counteract these unpredictable movement
At the end you should be able to get up line and hold yourself for a short time
If you are unsure about any execution, please ask me and/or try it with external help

tips.description: Start at the sweet-spot, which is in about 1/4 of the line. This is generally an area with a comfortable vibration characteristic
Your foot should be always in alignment with the slackline
Don't forget to have your arms over the shoulder and bent in about 135 degree position
If you have troubles with holding the arms up try to turn your palms to the top and your body will automatically raise your arms
Your head is up and focus set to a specific point in front of you
Learn the interplay with your arms, upper and lower body for counterbalancing
Sit down along with the line, slightly more in the direction you choosed
One foot is on the ground bent
Stretch your other foot forward and raise it up
Be sure your arms are over your shoulder and stretched out
Sit down along with the line, slightly more in the direction you choosed
Your chosen sides foot is on the ground and bent
Stretch your other foot forward and raise it up
Be sure your arms are over your shoulder and stretched out
Sit down on the line, slightly more to the side you choosed
Your chosen sides foot is on the ground and bent
Stretch your other leg forward and raise it up
Be sure your arms are over your shoulder and stretched out
Sit down on the line, slightly more to the side you choosed
Your chosen sides foot is on the ground and bent
Stretch your other leg forward and raise it up
Be sure your arms are over your shoulder and stretched out
Stay next to the line
Now put your foot next to the slackline on the line
Foot on the line is parallel with it
With a little momentum get up and stay on the line
Your other foot serves to balance your body
Bend the knees of the standing leg slightly
Be sure your arms are stretched out and over your shoulder
Stay next to the line
Now put your foot next to the slackline on the line
Foot on the line is parallel with it
With a little momentum get up and stay on the line
Your other foot serves to balance your body
Bend the knees of the standing leg slightly
Be sure your arms are stretched out and over your shoulder
Stay next to the line
Now put your foot across to the slackline on the line, such that your standing leg crosses your balancing leg
Foot on the line is parallel with it
With a little momentum get up and stay on the line
Your other foot serves to balance your body
Bend the knees of the standing leg slightly
Be sure your arms are stretched out and over your shoulder
Stay next to the line
Now put your foot across to the slackline on the line, such that your standing leg crosses your balancing leg
Foot on the line is parallel with it
With a little momentum get up and stay on the line
Your other foot serves to balance your body
Bend the knees of the standing leg slightly
Be sure your arms are stretched out and over your shoulder

goals.description: Now it gets more difficult for you. All former learned techniques should now be applied
You will fulfill static exercises and first approaches for walking on the line
With this you learn the basics for staying and the preparation for making some steps
At the end you should have learned the basics for slacklining, be able to stay a couple of seconds on the line and feel more confident on it

tips.description: At first you might not be able to stay on the slackline because of the unexpected body movements. But this is okay! Just focus and try it again
Keep in mind: focus point, sweet-spot, foot in line, knees slightly bent, arms up, relaxed muscles but straight upper body
Perform slowly and controlled, no need to hurry
Your non-standing foot serves also as balance support
It might help, when going up, to keep your non standing leg vertical in line with your other standing leg and then raise it to the side
The pressure is mostly around the ball of your foot
Stay sideways near to the line
Put your foot next to the line on it
Arms over shoulder and stretched out
Now with a little momentum get up the line
Stay on the line and balance out with your arms and the other leg
Stay sideways near to the line
Put your foot next to the line on it
Arms over shoulder and stretched out
Now with a little momentum get up the line
Stay on the line and balance out with your arms and the other leg
Stay sideways near to the line
Now put your other foot on the line by crossing the near foot
Arms over shoulder and stretched out
Now with a little momentum get up the line
Your other leg should now go to the other side of the slackline
Stay on the line and balance out with your arms and the other leg
Stay sideways near to the line
Now put your other foot on the line by crossing the near foot
Arms over shoulder and stretched out
Now with a little momentum get up the line
Your other leg should now go to the other side of the slackline
Stay on the line and balance out with your arms and the other leg
Stay sideways near to the line
Now put your foot next to the line on it
Arms over shoulder and stretched out
Now with a little momentum get up the line
Place your other foot in front of your standing foot
Hold this position and balance out with your arms, upper body and hips
Stay sideways near to the line
Now put your foot next to the line on it
Arms over shoulder and stretched out
Now with a little momentum get up the line
Place your other foot in front of your standing foot
Hold this position and balance out with your arms, upper body and hips
Stay sideways near to the line
Now put your other foot further away from the line on it
Arms over shoulder and stretched out
Now with a little momentum get up the line
Place your other foot in front of your standing foot
Hold this position and balance out with your arms, upper body and hips
Stay sideways near to the line
Now put your other foot further away from the line on it
Arms over shoulder and stretched out
Now with a little momentum get up the line
Place your other foot in front of your standing foot
Hold this position and balance out with your arms, upper body and hips
Stay sideways near to the line
Now put your other foot next to the line on it
Arms over shoulder and stretched out
Now with a little momentum get up the line
Hold this position and get up and down
Stay sideways near to the line
Now put your other foot next to the line on it
Arms over shoulder and stretched out
Now with a little momentum get up the line
Hold this position and get up and down

goals.description: Congratulations! You achieved to stay on the slackline!
For this last tier, you will learn how to make your first steps as continuation to the last two exercise from the former tier
You should then be able to walk step by step without getting out of balance

tips.description: When making a step you can guide your non standing foot to the side of the line and shift it forward. With this you won't miss the line
Also let your knees together when walking forward, so your legs can support each other
Make small steps, your bodie's center of gravity doesn't have to be shiftet that much forward, which results in less balancing problems
Use your whole body to counterbalance
Remember to stay calm and execute the exercise slowly and controlled, especially for this tier
Get on the line with your foot next to the line
Now put your balancing foot in front of your standing foot
Shift your body slightly to the front and put your weight on the front foot
As soon as you feel confident and safe, remove the rear standing leg
Hold the gesture as long as you can
Get on the line with your foot next to the line
Now put your balancing foot in front of your standing foot
Shift your body slightly to the front and put your weight on the front foot
As soon as you feel confident and safe, remove the rear standing leg
Hold the gesture as long as you can
Get on the line with your other foot further away to the line
Now put your balancing foot in front of your standing one
Shift your body slightly to the front and put your weight on the front foot
As soon as you feel confident and safe, remove the rear standing leg
Hold the gesture as long as you can
Get on the line with your other foot further away to the line
Now put your balancing foot in front of your standing one
Shift your body slightly to the front and put your weight on the front foot
As soon as you feel confident and safe, remove the rear standing leg
Hold the gesture as long as you can
Get on the line with your foot next to the line
Now put your balancing foot in front of your standing one
Shift your body slightly to the front and put your weight on the front foot
As soon as you feel confident and safe, remove the rear standing leg
Repeat steps 1 to 4 to walk until the end
Get on the line with your foot next to the line
Now put your balancing foot in front of your standing one
Shift your body slightly to the front and put your weight on the front foot
As soon as you feel confident and safe, remove the rear standing leg
Repeat steps 1 to 4 to walk until the end
